events.originalText: Annexation of Crimea: The Autonomous Republic of Crimea held a controversial referendum in which voters overwhelmingly chose to join Russia as a federal subject.
events.subtitle: Annexation of Crimea by the Russian Federation
events.headline: Crimea Votes to Join Russia in Controversial Referendum

events.originalText: American peace activist Rachel Corrie was crushed to death by an Israel Defense Forces armored bulldozer in Rafah while protesting the demolition of a Palestinian house.
events.subtitle: Rachel Corrie
events.headline: American Peace Activist Crushed by IDF Bulldozer in Rafah

events.originalText: A series of bomb blasts in the city of Shijiazhuang, China, killed 108 people.
events.subtitle: Shijiazhuang bombings
events.headline: 108 Killed in Bomb Blasts in Shijiazhuang, China

events.originalText: Using pistols and grenades, Michael Stone attacked the funeral of three Provisional IRA members who had been killed in Gibraltar ten days earlier, killing three attendees and injuring at least sixty others.
events.subtitle: Michael Stone (loyalist)
events.headline: Michael Stone Attacks Funeral, Killing Three in Gibraltar

events.originalText: Iran–Iraq War: Iraqi forces began attacking the Kurdish town of Halabja with chemical weapons, killing up to 5,000 people.
events.subtitle: Iran–Iraq War
events.headline: Iraqi Forces Attack Halabja with Chemical Weapons, Killing Thousands

events.originalText: William Buckley, the U.S. Central Intelligence Agency station chief in Beirut, Lebanon, was kidnapped by Islamic fundamentalists.
events.subtitle: William Francis Buckley
events.headline: CIA Station Chief in Beirut Kidnapped by Islamic Fundamentalists

events.originalText: Vietnam War: American soldiers killed hundreds of unarmed civilians in the Sơn Mỹ village in the Sơn Tịnh District of South Vietnam.
events.subtitle: Vietnam War
events.headline: American Soldiers Kill Hundreds of Civilians in Sơn Mỹ Village

events.originalText: Flying Tiger Line Flight 739, a charter flight carrying U.S. and South Vietnamese soldiers, disappeared without a trace, prompting one of the largest searches in the history of the Pacific.
events.subtitle: Flying Tiger Line Flight 739
events.headline: Flying Tiger Line Flight 739 Disappears Without a Trace

events.originalText: Conscription was re-introduced in Germany by the Nazi regime, and the German military was renamed the Wehrmacht.
events.subtitle: Conscription
events.headline: Nazi Regime Re-Introduces Conscription in Germany

events.originalText: In the inaugural final of the FA Cup (trophy pictured) Wanderers defeated Royal Engineers 1–0 at The Oval in Kennington, London.
events.subtitle: 1872 FA Cup final
events.headline: Wanderers Defeat Royal Engineers in Inaugural FA Cup Final

events.originalText: The Bank for Savings in the City of New-York, of the first banks in the U.S. and the first savings bank in New York City, was incorporated.
events.subtitle: The Bank for Savings in the City of New-York
events.headline: Bank for Savings in New York City Incorporated

events.originalText: Congress passed the Military Peace Establishment Act, authorizing the establishment of the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers to operate the U.S. Military Academy (pictured) at West Point, New York.
events.subtitle: United States Congress
events.headline: Congress Authorizes Establishment of U.S. Military Academy at West Point

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: Spain captured the island of Roatán from England off the coast of what is now Honduras.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: Spain Captures Roatán from England in American Revolutionary War

events.originalText: The Royal Welch Fusiliers, one of the oldest line-infantry regiments of the British Army, was founded.
events.subtitle: Royal Welch Fusiliers
events.headline: Royal Welch Fusiliers Founded in British Army

events.originalText: Samoset, a member of the Abenaki tribe, walked into Plymouth Colony and greeted the Pilgrims in English (depicted).
events.subtitle: Samoset
events.headline: Abenaki Tribe Member Greets Pilgrims in English at Plymouth Colony

events.originalText: Despenser War: A royalist army defeated troops loyal to Thomas, 2nd Earl of Lancaster, in the Battle of Boroughbridge, which allowed King Edward II of England to hold on to power for another five years.
events.subtitle: Despenser War
events.headline: Royalist Army Defeats Troops in Battle of Boroughbridge

events.originalText: Around 150 Jews died inside York Castle, the majority committing mass suicide to avoid being killed by a mob.
events.subtitle: York Castle
events.headline: Mass Suicide Inside York Castle to Avoid Mob Killings

events.originalText: Five Dynasties and Ten Kingdoms period: Chinese general Meng Zhixiang proclaimed himself emperor and established Later Shu as a new state independent of Later Tang.
events.subtitle: Five Dynasties and Ten Kingdoms period
events.headline: Meng Zhixiang Proclaims Himself Emperor, Establishes Later Shu

events.originalText: Babylonian king Nebuchadnezzar II captured Jerusalem and installed Zedekiah as King of Judah.
events.subtitle: 590s BC
events.headline: Nebuchadnezzar II Captures Jerusalem, Installs Zedekiah as King
